snippet: Officials said on Thursday that the electrical systems of the vessel were out but that its roughly 150,000 gallons of diesel fuel and lubricants were intact.
abstract: Coast Guard and Shell Oil officials say drilling rig that ran aground in Gulf of Alaska has incurred water damage to its deck and electrical systems but is otherwise stable; say there is no sign that any of the roughly 150,000 gallons of diesel fuel and lubricants have leaked or of other environmental damage caused by rig.
lead_paragraph: Officials said on Thursday that the electrical systems of the vessel were out but that its roughly 150,000 gallons of diesel fuel and lubricants were intact.

headline.seo: Shell Oil Rig Aground off Alaska Is Not Leaking, Officials Say
headline.main: Oil Rig Aground off Alaska Is Damaged but Not Leaking, Shell and Coast Guard Say
headline.print_headline: Oil Rig Aground Off Alaska Is Damaged but Not Leaking, Shell and Coast Guard Say
